intro: Convolvulus heptaphyllus, commonly known as the seven-leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is a member of the Bindweed family (Convolvulaceae) and is known for its rapid growth and ability to climb or spread along the ground. Convolvulus heptaphyllus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and can also serve as a food source for certain insects.
